entries.meaning: A single quotation mark, ('). This is often used for a quote within a quote, as in "Tom said 'What?'"
A punctuation mark to indicate that the text is a semi-quote, i.e. a close paraphrase that uses some of the author's original words.

examples: "A fanatic is someone who will not change his mind or the subject of discussion" is a semiquote of Winston Churchill.

verbs.description: semiquote (third-person singular simple present semiquotes, present participle semiquoting, simple past and past participle semiquoted)

entries.meaning: To make a close paraphrase of a quotation, using some of its words.
